intro: Forficaria graminifolia, commonly known as the common mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine white hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is typically found in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and grasslands. Forficaria graminifolia is an herbaceous perennial that is often used in traditional herbal medicine.
